title: BiocYES: Cancer data science for DFCI YES for CURE
text: BiocYES package collects software documentation introduction data science domain cancer biology, epidemiology, treatment. 2022 five main modules covered: Cancer maps Cancer anatomy Cancer clinical trials Molecular biology cancer: data science considerations Patient-initiated research

what: Some basic statistics by “metropolitan statistical area”
title: BiocYES: Cancer data science for DFCI YES for CURE
code: library(tibble) library(dplyr) data(woncan_meta) cat(woncan_meta, sep="\n") ## "---" ## "Dataset: United States and Puerto Rico Cancer Statistics, 1999-2018 Incidence" ## "Query Parameters:" ## "Group By: Cancer Sites; MSA" ## "Show Totals: Disabled" ## "Show Zero Values: True" ## "Show Suppressed: False" ## "Calculate Rates Per: 100,000" ## "Standard Population: 2000 U.S. Std. Million" ## "---" ## "Help: See http://wonder.cdc.gov/wonder/help/cancer-v2018.html for more information." ## "---" ## "Query Date: Feb 20, 2022 7:17:02 PM" ## "---" ## "Suggested Citation: United States Cancer Statistics - Incidence: 1999 - 2018, WONDER Online Database. United States Department" ## "of Health and Human Services, Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and National Cancer Institute; 2021. Accessed at" ## "http://wonder.cdc.gov/cancer-v2018.html on Feb 20, 2022 7:17:02 PM" ## "---" data(woncan) littab = woncan |> select(MSA, `Cancer Sites`, Age.Adjusted.Rate) |> as.data.frame() datatable(littab)

code: library(sf) data(us_county_geo) us_county_geo[1,] |> select(state, county, geometry) ## Simple feature collection with 1 feature and 2 fields ## Geometry type: POINT ## Dimension:     XY ## Bounding box:  xmin: -86.64644 ymin: 32.53224 xmax: -86.64644 ymax: 32.53224 ## CRS:           NA ## # A tibble: 1 × 3 ##   state county                     geometry ##   <chr> <chr>                       <POINT> ## 1 AL    Autauga County (-86.64644 32.53224)

what: Cancer data science activities for CZI YES for CURE collaboration
title: Cancer data science activities for CZI YES for CURE collaboration
text: Software documentation Chan-Zuckerberg Initiative project Bioconductor’s diversity inclusiveness DFCI YES CURE. primary concern develop open resources training high school undergraduate students cancer data science. Topics addressed Mapping cancer rates Cancer anatomy Cancer clinical trials Molecular biology cancers Patient-initiated research cancer topics addressed Jupyter notebooks, R markdown documents, “shiny apps”, instruct subject matter cancer data science, operation computational tools solve problems areas.

title: simple display of confidence intervals for cancer incidence — plotwci
code: plotwci(   tab,   metric = "incidence per 100000 2014-2018",   site = "Overall",   xlab = "Massachusetts counties",   ylim = c(350, 620) )

title: simple display of confidence intervals for cancer incidence — plotwci
text: tab CSV file columns provided via https://gis.cdc.gov/CANCER/USCS/#/StateCounty/ metric character(1) detailed description statistic site character(1) name anatomic site xlab character(1) label x axis ylim numeric(2) extent y axis units incidence per 100000

title: simple display of confidence intervals for cancer incidence — plotwci
code: oldpar = par(no.readonly=TRUE) prost = read.csv(system.file("csv/MASSProstateWCI.csv", package="BiocYES")) bre = read.csv(system.file("csv/MABreastWCI.csv", package="BiocYES")) par(mfrow=c(1,2)) plotwci(prost, site="Prostate", ylim=c(60,180)) plotwci(bre, site="Breast", ylim=c(90,270))  par(oldpar)
